channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: CLOUDSPAM: Contrastive Learning On Unlabeled Data for Segmentation and Pre-Training Using Aggregated Point Clouds and MoCo
item.description: However, this merging is not a straightforward procedure due to the variety of size and number of points in the point clouds of these datasets.

item.title: Unleashing Reasoning Capability of LLMs via Scalable Question Synthesis from Scratch
item.description: The availability of high-quality data is one of the most important factors in improving the reasoning capability of LLMs.

item.title: DreamClear: High-Capacity Real-World Image Restoration with Privacy-Safe Dataset Curation
item.description: Our second contribution, DreamClear, is a DiT-based image restoration model.

item.title: SMITE: Segment Me In TimE
item.description: Segmenting an object in a video presents significant challenges.

item.title: Towards Better Open-Ended Text Generation: A Multicriteria Evaluation Framework
item.description: Open-ended text generation has become a prominent task in natural language processing due to the rise of powerful (large) language models.

item.title: Multi-Class Abnormality Classification in Video Capsule Endoscopy Using Deep Learning
item.description: This report outlines Team Seq2Cure's deep learning approach for the Capsule Vision 2024 Challenge, leveraging an ensemble of convolutional neural networks (CNNs) and transformer-based architectures for multi-class abnormality classification in video capsule endoscopy frames.

item.title: Retrieval-Augmented Diffusion Models for Time Series Forecasting
item.description: Meanwhile, this reference-guided mechanism also compensates for the deficiencies of existing time series diffusion models in terms of guidance.

item.title: Distill Visual Chart Reasoning Ability from LLMs to MLLMs
item.description: Specifically, we employ text-based synthesizing techniques to construct chart-plotting code and produce ReachQA, a dataset containing 3k reasoning-intensive charts and 20k Q&A pairs to enhance both recognition and reasoning abilities.

item.title: Iterative Self-Tuning LLMs for Enhanced Jailbreaking Capabilities
item.description: Recent research has shown that Large Language Models (LLMs) are vulnerable to automated jailbreak attacks, where adversarial suffixes crafted by algorithms appended to harmful queries bypass safety alignment and trigger unintended responses.

item.title: Irregular Tensor Low-Rank Representation for Hyperspectral Image Representation
item.description: However, the spatial distribution of the HSI is always irregular, while the previous tensor low-rank representation methods can only be applied to the regular data cubes, which limits the performance.

item.title: SIKeD: Self-guided Iterative Knowledge Distillation for mathematical reasoning
item.description: While LLMs can accurately solve reasoning tasks through a variety of strategies, even without fine-tuning, smaller models are not expressive enough to fit the LLMs distribution on all strategies when distilled and tend to prioritize one strategy over the others.

item.title: Probabilistic Language-Image Pre-Training
item.description: Vision-language models (VLMs) embed aligned image-text pairs into a joint space but often rely on deterministic embeddings, assuming a one-to-one correspondence between images and texts.

item.title: Link, Synthesize, Retrieve: Universal Document Linking for Zero-Shot Information Retrieval
item.description: Despite the recent advancements in information retrieval (IR), zero-shot IR remains a significant challenge, especially when dealing with new domains, languages, and newly-released use cases that lack historical query traffic from existing users.

item.title: Exploiting Interpretable Capabilities with Concept-Enhanced Diffusion and Prototype Networks
item.description: Concept-based machine learning methods have increasingly gained importance due to the growing interest in making neural networks interpretable.

item.title: Large Language Models Reflect the Ideology of their Creators
item.description: By identifying and analyzing moral assessments reflected in the generated descriptions, we find consistent normative differences between how the same LLM responds in Chinese compared to English.

item.title: Dynamic Vocabulary Pruning in Early-Exit LLMs
item.description: Increasing the size of large language models (LLMs) has been shown to lead to better performance.

item.title: Low-Latency Video Anonymization for Crowd Anomaly Detection: Privacy vs. Performance
item.description: We evaluated the approaches on publicly available privacy and VAD data sets to examine the strengths and weaknesses of the different anonymization techniques and highlight the promising efficacy of our approach.

item.title: End-to-end Training for Recommendation with Language-based User Profiles
item.description: While existing work has shown that language-based profiles from standard LLMs can be effective, such generalist LLMs are unlikely to be optimal for this task.

item.title: PRISM: A Methodology for Auditing Biases in Large Language Models
item.description: Auditing Large Language Models (LLMs) to discover their biases and preferences is an emerging challenge in creating Responsible Artificial Intelligence (AI).

item.title: WAFFLE: Multi-Modal Model for Automated Front-End Development
item.description: Web development involves turning UI designs into functional webpages, which can be difficult for both beginners and experienced developers due to the complexity of HTML's hierarchical structures and styles.

item.title: Moving Object Segmentation in Point Cloud Data using Hidden Markov Models
item.description: Autonomous agents require the capability to identify dynamic objects in their environment for safe planning and navigation.

item.title: On Explaining with Attention Matrices
item.description: We introduce and effectively compute efficient attention, which isolates the effective components of attention matrices in tasks and models in which AW play an explanatory role.

item.title: Should We Really Edit Language Models? On the Evaluation of Edited Language Models
item.description: Our findings indicate that current editing methods are only suitable for small-scale knowledge updates within language models, which motivates further research on more practical and reliable editing methods.

item.title: Robust Watermarking Using Generative Priors Against Image Editing: From Benchmarking to Advances
item.description: Current image watermarking methods are vulnerable to advanced image editing techniques enabled by large-scale text-to-image models.

item.title: DeCoRe: Decoding by Contrasting Retrieval Heads to Mitigate Hallucinations
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) often hallucinate, producing unfaithful or factually incorrect outputs by misrepresenting the provided context or incorrectly recalling internal knowledge.

item.title: 3D-Adapter: Geometry-Consistent Multi-View Diffusion for High-Quality 3D Generation
item.description: Multi-view image diffusion models have significantly advanced open-domain 3D object generation.

item.title: Wavetable Synthesis Using CVAE for Timbre Control Based on Semantic Label
item.description: This research introduces a method of timbre control in wavetable synthesis that is intuitive and sensible and utilizes semantic labels.

item.title: Bilinear Sequence Regression: A Model for Learning from Long Sequences of High-dimensional Tokens
item.description: Statistical physics provides powerful tools to study the functioning of learning with neural networks and has played a recognized role in the development of modern machine learning.

item.title: From Imitation to Introspection: Probing Self-Consciousness in Language Models
item.description: Self-consciousness, the introspection of one's existence and thoughts, represents a high-level cognitive process.

item.title: Thermal Chameleon: Task-Adaptive Tone-mapping for Radiometric Thermal-Infrared images
item.description: Thermal Infrared (TIR) imaging provides robust perception for navigating in challenging outdoor environments but faces issues with poor texture and low image contrast due to its 14/16-bit format.

item.title: MissNODAG: Differentiable Cyclic Causal Graph Learning from Incomplete Data
item.description: Causal discovery in real-world systems, such as biological networks, is often complicated by feedback loops and incomplete data.

item.title: KVSharer: Efficient Inference via Layer-Wise Dissimilar KV Cache Sharing
item.description: Additionally, we verify that \textit{KVSharer} is compatible with existing intra-layer KV cache compression methods, and combining both can further save memory.

item.title: Difficult for Whom? A Study of Japanese Lexical Complexity
item.description: The tasks of lexical complexity prediction (LCP) and complex word identification (CWI) commonly presuppose that difficult to understand words are shared by the target population.

item.title: Smart ETL and LLM-based contents classification: the European Smart Tourism Tools Observatory experience
item.description: Results: The Smart ETL process to import STTs to the observatory combines PDF-scraping techniques with LLMs for text content-based classification.

item.title: Stable Consistency Tuning: Understanding and Improving Consistency Models
item.description: Diffusion models achieve superior generation quality but suffer from slow generation speed due to the iterative nature of denoising.

item.title: Classifier Clustering and Feature Alignment for Federated Learning under Distributed Concept Drift
item.description: Moreover, to address data heterogeneity, we study the feature alignment under distributed concept drift, and find two factors that are crucial for feature alignment: the conditional distribution $P(Y|X)$ and the degree of data heterogeneity.

item.title: Context is Key: A Benchmark for Forecasting with Essential Textual Information
item.description: To address this, we introduce "Context is Key" (CiK), a time series forecasting benchmark that pairs numerical data with diverse types of carefully crafted textual context, requiring models to integrate both modalities.

item.title: Demystifying Large Language Models for Medicine: A Primer
item.description: We then review the strategies, such as prompt engineering and fine-tuning, to adapt standard LLMs to specialized medical tasks.

item.title: Scaling up Masked Diffusion Models on Text
item.description: Masked diffusion models (MDMs) have shown promise in language modeling, yet their scalability and effectiveness in core language tasks, such as text generation and language understanding, remain underexplored.

item.title: Homomorphism Counts as Structural Encodings for Graph Learning
item.description: Graph Transformers are popular neural networks that extend the well-known Transformer architecture to the graph domain.

item.title: A Joint Representation Using Continuous and Discrete Features for Cardiovascular Diseases Risk Prediction on Chest CT Scans
item.description: In this work, we proposed a novel joint representation that integrates discrete quantitative biomarkers and continuous deep features extracted from chest CT scans.

item.title: Fully Stochastic Primal-dual Gradient Algorithm for Non-convex Optimization on Random Graphs
item.description: Stochastic decentralized optimization algorithms often suffer from issues such as synchronization overhead and intermittent communication.

item.title: LOGO -- Long cOntext aliGnment via efficient preference Optimization
item.description: To overcome the GPU memory-bound issue caused by the long sequence, LOGO employs a reference-free preference optimization strategy and adopts a position synthesis method to construct the training data.

item.title: Enhancing pretraining efficiency for medical image segmentation via transferability metrics
item.description: By examining over 300 combinations of models, datasets, and training methods, we find that shorter pretraining often leads to better results on the downstream task, providing additional proof to the well-known fact that the accuracy of the model on ImageNet is a poor indicator for downstream performance.

item.title: Tuning-free coreset Markov chain Monte Carlo
item.description: A Bayesian coreset is a small, weighted subset of a data set that replaces the full data during inference to reduce computational cost.

item.title: Real-time 3D-aware Portrait Video Relighting
item.description: We demonstrate the effectiveness and interactivity of our method on various portrait videos with diverse lighting and viewing conditions.

item.title: What If the Input is Expanded in OOD Detection?
item.description: Based on that, we formalize a new scoring method, namely, Confidence aVerage (CoVer), which can capture the dynamic differences by simply averaging the scores obtained from different corrupted inputs and the original ones, making the OOD and ID distributions more separable in detection tasks.

item.title: IMAN: An Adaptive Network for Robust NPC Mortality Prediction with Missing Modalities
item.description: Accurate prediction of mortality in nasopharyngeal carcinoma (NPC), a complex malignancy particularly challenging in advanced stages, is crucial for optimizing treatment strategies and improving patient outcomes.

item.title: FreCaS: Efficient Higher-Resolution Image Generation via Frequency-aware Cascaded Sampling
item.description: While image generation with diffusion models has achieved a great success, generating images of higher resolution than the training size remains a challenging task due to the high computational cost.

item.title: CAMEL-Bench: A Comprehensive Arabic LMM Benchmark
item.description: In this work, we develop a comprehensive LMM evaluation benchmark for the Arabic language to represent a large population of over 400 million speakers.
